case_vignette: A previously healthy 60-year-old man comes to his physician because of progressively worsening shortness of breath for the past 2 months. He does not experience shortness of breath at rest. He also occasionally has a dry cough. He has not had fever, chills, or night sweats. He has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years. He drinks a beer daily and occasionally more on weekends. He does not use illicit drugs. He is 183 cm (6 ft 0 in) tall and weighs 66 kg (145 lbs); BMI is 19.7 kg/m2. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 94/min, respirations are 21/min, and blood pressure is 136/88 mm Hg. Lung auscultation reveals a prolonged expiratory phase and end-expiratory wheezing. Spirometry shows an FEV1:FVC ratio of 62%, an FEV1 of 60% of predicted, and a total lung capacity of 125% of predicted. The diffusion capacity of the lung (DLCO) is decreased.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing progressively worsening shortness of breath for the past 2 months and occasionally have a dry cough.
Have you noticed any particular time of day or activity when the shortness of breath worsens?
The shortness of breath gets worse when I'm active, but I don't have this problem when I'm resting.
Do you have any chest pain or discomfort when you are experiencing shortness of breath?
No, I don't have any chest pain or discomfort with the shortness of breath.
Have you experienced any swelling in your legs or feet?
No, I haven't experienced any swelling in my legs or feet.
Do you have a history of any heart or lung problems?
No, I have been previously healthy without heart or lung problems.
Are you currently taking any medications?
No, I'm not taking any medications.
Have you recently had any infections or been sick with something else?
No, I haven't had any fever, chills, or night sweats, and I haven't been sick with anything else recently.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 60-year-old man.
Does your family have a history of heart disease, high blood pressure, or other cardiovascular conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of heart disease, high blood pressure, or other cardiovascular conditions.
Do you smoke, or have you been exposed to smoking or other pollutants in your environment?
Yes, I have smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years.
Do you experience any symptoms like wheezing, chest tightness, or have difficulty breathing at night?
I have been experiencing a dry cough occasionally, but I haven't mentioned any chest tightness or difficulty breathing at night.
**Final Diagnosis:** Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) due to long-term smoking.
